title: American_Top_40_1973_December_1st
description:
"You're hearing the hits as we count down to a brand new number one this week. This is part three of AT40, I'm Casey and the countdown rolls on."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

Casey tells us about the town of Nutbush, a town so small that it isn't on the map and doesn't have a mayor (but it has a song about it at number 38 by Ike & Tina Turner).

He also tells the story of how once, when tickets for a show by Sonny and Cher went on sale, 80,000 fans tied up the phone lines from to Lake Tahoe, from the Pacific Ocean to the Missouri River trying to get seats.

Jim Croce has the highest debuting song of the week ("Time In A Bottle" at number 18). This is the first time an artist posthumously ever had two records in the top 20 at the same time.

A listener writes in to inform Casey that AT40 was in an Al Pachino movie! The AT40 staff knew all about it, and Casey tells the story.
